item.title: Subtree of Another Tree
item.description: Given two non-empty binary trees s and t, check whether tree t has exactly the same structure and node values with a subtree of s. A subtree of s is a tree consists of a node in s and all of this node’s descendants. The tree s could also be considered as a subtree of itself. Example 1: Given tree s: 3 / \ 4 5 / \ 1 2 Given tree t:

item.title: Graph and Tree Basics
item.description: Tree: n - 1 edges, all nodes connected, contains no loop.
